text:
First Avenue, at and adjoining S.E. corner of 47th Street, showing a lunch wagon, repair, tire, and battery service, and a service and filling station, in the block where a number of old five-story tenements used to stand prior to about 1931.
The building partially shown at the extreme right is the old Wilson & Company slaughter house, on the S.E. corner of 46th Street.
July 3, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
